lead_paragraph: In a new memoir, “Awesome Bill From Dawsonville: My Life in NASCAR,” the former Nascar champion Bill Elliott accused Nascar of not getting serious about long-standing safety concerns until after Dale Earnhardt’s fatal crash on the final lap of the 2001 Daytona 500.
